intro: Gallitrichum clusii, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Gallitrichum clusii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
